name: Calculation1
dax_expression:
SWITCH(TRUE(),
	'Orders (Sample - Superstore (1))'[Category] = "Furniture", "furniture",
	'Orders (Sample - Superstore (1))'[Category] = "Office Supplies", "office supplier",
	'Orders (Sample - Superstore (1))'[Category] = "Technology", "technology",
	'Orders (Sample - Superstore (1))'[Category]
)
solution_explanation: Converted Tableau IF/ELSEIF chain into a DAX SWITCH(TRUE(), ...) expression to perform row-level mapping based on the Category column. All column references use the table['Column'] syntax.
type_changed_reason: This calculation applies row-level logic without aggregation, so it should be created as a calculated column.
